TopicTitle: The Sierra Nevada Corp CCtCap Challenge

Articles.Content:
This thread is a split from this thread (http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93907-CCiCap-was-announced-SpaceX-and-Boeing-were-selected/) that is just to discuss the SNC challenge to the CCtCap Program and its implications and effects.

Starting off with some new news...

http://spaceflightnow.com/news/n1410/01cctcapprotest/#.VCzrZ_ldWSo

so Nibb and Kryten you were right, it will delay the program the only loophole suggested by that article is

Officials did not say if the work stoppage prevents activities using internal funds.

which is more a loophole that SpaceX is more likely to take than Boeing

Also the OFFICIAL GAO dockett link is

http://www.gao.gov/docket/B-410485.1

The Attorney is Eric M. Ransom

Edited October 2, 2014 by B787_300
adding in the GAO link

SpaceX will continue working for now largely because they still have CCiCap milestones to complete, which are unrelated to the CCtCap challenge. If the GAO manages to resolve the challenge by the end of the year, SpaceX will probably not really be affected. Last CCiCap milestone is (IIRC) the inflight abort test in January 2015.

The automatic stay is a big incentive for protesting to the GAO.

There's nothing stopping work on the fixed price parts of the contract, just no guarantee they get paid for it
Update: Tomorrow morning is the first hearing on a case in the court.

So a couple of things have happened. After the ordered Work Stop by NASA, they used statutory authority to tell Boeing and SpaceX that they can continue to work on the project. SNC then filed a case seeking an injunction to force a work stopage

The US Government's Accountability Office has issued a Statement on Sierra Nevada Bid Protest Decision.

P.S. Sorry in advance if I offended anyone by necroing this thread, but I thought it better to post here rather than start a new one.
